intro: Derris kirkii, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers. Its roots contain the alkaloid rotenone, which has insecticidal properties. Derris kirkii is often used in traditional medicine and as a natural pesticide.
